moves.1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nd7 3. Nc3 Ngf6 4. Be3 e5: ?! Not sure why White thought this was good, it opens up lines of attack on the Q side.
moves.8... bxc6 9. O-O-O Qc7 10. f3 Nb6 11. h4: Black wastes no time in beginning the attack.
moves.18. c3 d3 19. Bf1 Qd8: To force f4 to take the pressure off of e5, so that Black can concentrate on attacking the W king.
moves.23. a3 Bxh3 24. Rxh3 Nd7: Black wants the N to go to c5.
moves.25. h6: hoping for a pawn exchange to open lines.
moves.26. Nf3 Nc5 27. Nd4 Rd8: ! Fairly obvious but White has good moves now.
moves.28. Qe3 Rxd4 29. Nd2: ? Overlooks checkmate. There are not any good moves but White could fight on with Rd2.
moves.29... Rd7: ? Quick move, forgot about the immediate checkmate, although Black has an easy win anyway after say Kb1.
